intro: Spermacoce terminaliflora, commonly known as the Brazilian morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release numerous tiny, black seeds. Spermacoce terminaliflora is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in tropical and subtropical climates.
